1.q_string: Which of the following metal ions precipitates as a sulphide upon treatment with ammoniacal H<sub>2</sub>S?

An aqueous solution of a mixture of two inorganic salts, when treated with dilute HCl, gave a precipitate (P) and a filtrate (Q). The precipitate P was found to dissolve in hot water. The filtrate (Q) remained unchanged when treated with H2S in a dilute mineral acid medium. However, it gave a precipitate (R) with H2S in an ammoniacal medium. The precipitate (R) gave a coloured solution (S) when treated with H2O2 in an aqueous NaOH medium.

The precipitate (P) contains

An aqueous solution of a mixture of two inorganic salts, when treated with dilute HCl, gave a precipitate (P) and a filtrate (Q). The precipitate P was found to dissolve in hot water. The filtrate (Q) remained unchanged when treated with H2S in a dilute mineral acid medium. However, it gave a precipitate (R) with H2S in an ammoniacal medium. The precipitate (R) gave a coloured solution (S) when treated with H2O2 in an aqueous NaOH medium.

The coloured solution (S) contains

q_option: A grey blue gelatinous precipitate of Cr(OH)<sub>3</sub> and a white precipitate of Mn(OH)<sub>2</sub> are formed.
A grey blue precipitate of Cr(OH)<sub>3 </sub>and soluble Na<sub>2</sub>MnO<sub>4</sub> are formed.
A brown precipitate of hydrated manganese dioxide and soluble yellow-coloured Na<sub>2</sub>CrO<sub>4</sub> are formed.
Initially, Mn(OH)<sub>2</sub> and Cr(OH)<sub>3</sub> are formed as precipitates.
1.q_string: Which of the following changes occurs when a solution containing Mn<sup>2+</sup> and Cr<sup>3+ </sup>is heated with NaOH solution and H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub>?

When X reacts with 7 moles of H2O, it gives 4 moles of an acid A and 2 moles of a base B. On heating X.10H2O, it gives X, which on further heating gives C and D. D is an anhydride of acid A. When X.10H2O is heated in a Bunsen burner flame with CoO on a loop of platinum wire, a blue colour bead is formed.

The central atom of 'C' is an element of which group?

q_option: The equivalent weight of CuS is M<sub>2</sub>/5.
The equivalent weight of Al(MnO<sub>4</sub>)<sub>3 </sub>is M<sub>3</sub>/3.
The equivalent weight of Al(MnO<sub>4</sub>)<sub>3</sub> is M<sub>3</sub>/5.
The equivalent weight of Cu<sub>2</sub>S is M<sub>1</sub>/8.
1.q_string: When a mixture of Cu<sub style="font-family:">2</sub>S and CuS is titrated with Al(MnO<sub style="font-family:">4</sub>)<sub style="font-family:">3</sub> in acidic medium, the oxidation products Cu<sub style="font-family:">2</sub>S and CuS obtained are Cu (+ 2) and SO<sub style="font-family:">2</sub>. If the molecular weights of Cu<sub style="font-family:">2</sub>S, CuS and Al (MnO<sub style="font-family:">4</sub>)<sub style="font-family:">3</sub> be M<sub style="font-family:">1</sub>, M<sub style="font-family:">2</sub> and M<sub style="font-family:">3</sub>, respectively, then which of the following statements is correct?

Consider the following apparatus set in a lab to prepare SO2 gas.

In the given diagram, what is the name of the chemical which is added from the top and marked as &aposY&apos?

The ion that cannot by precipitated by both HCl and H2S is:-

(a) \(\mathrm{Pb}^{2+}\)
(b) \(\mathrm{Cu}^{+}\)
(c) Ba2+
In a protein molecule, various amino acids are linked together by:

q_option: When a small quantity of solid sample is heated with dilute H<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub>, a pungent smelling gas is liberated, which turns a paper soaked in Na<sub>2</sub>CrO<sub>4</sub> green.
When a small amount of the sample is heated with Zn and diluted H<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub>, a gas with smell of rotten eggs is produced.
When aqueous solution of the salt is added to BaCl<sub>2</sub> solution, a white precipitate insoluble in dilute HCl is obtained.
When Br<sub>2</sub> water is added to aqueous solution of the salt, the red colour is not discharged.
1.q_string:
Directions: The following question has four choices, out of which ONE or MORE is/are correct. 
Which of the following statements is/are true for Na2SO3?

q_option: Pb<sup>2+ </sup>ion can be precipitated as sulphide both from neutral and acidic solutions.
Zn<sup>2+</sup> can be precipitated by hydrogen sulphide from both alkaline and neutral solutions.
Bi<sup>3+</sup> cannot be precipitated as sulphide by hydrogen sulphide in neutral solution.
Mn<sup>2+</sup> can be precipitated as sulphide by hydrogen sulphide from both acidic and basic solutions, but not from neutral solution.
1.q_string:
Directions: The following question has four choices, out of which ONE or MORE is/are correct. 

Which of the following statements regarding precipitation of sulphide of a metal ion by hydrogen sulphide is/are true?
The compound insoluble in acetic acid is:
The brown ring complex compound is formulated as [Fe(H2O)5(NO)+]SO4. The oxidation state of iron is:

Which of the following will not give positive chromyl chloride test?
A. copper chloride, \(C u C l_{2}\)
B. mercuric chloride, \(H g C l_{2}\)
C. zinc chloride, \(Z n C l_{2}\)
What is the formula of borax?
